title: Question 1: Who made you?
question: Who made you?
answer: God made me.

title: Question 2: What else did God make?
question: What else did God make?
answer: God made all things.

title: Question 3: Why did God make you and all things?
question: Why did God make you and all things?
answer: For his own glory.

title: Question 4: How can you glorify God?
question: How can you glorify God?
answer: By loving him and doing what he commands.

title: Question 5: Why ought you to glorify God?
question: Why ought you to glorify God?
answer: Because he made me and takes care of me.
activities: Sing Holy, Holy Holy Lord God Almighty. This song reminds us that God is holy, and that He is a Spirit. As you sing, think about how amazing it is that God is not like us, but He loves us and cares for us.

title: Question 6: Are there more gods than one?
question: Are there more gods than one?
answer: There is only one God.
activities: Sing Holy, Holy Holy Lord God Almighty. This song reminds us that God is holy, and that He is a Spirit. As you sing, think about how amazing it is that God is not like us, but He loves us and cares for us.

title: Question 7: In how many persons does this one God exist?
question: In how many persons does this one God exist?
answer: In three persons.
activities: Sing Holy, Holy Holy Lord God Almighty. This song reminds us that God is holy, and that He is a Spirit. As you sing, think about how amazing it is that God is not like us, but He loves us and cares for us.

title: Question 8: Who are the persons of the Trinity?
question: Who are the persons of the Trinity?
answer: The Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit.
activities: Sing Holy, Holy Holy Lord God Almighty. This song reminds us that God is holy, and that He is a Spirit. As you sing, think about how amazing it is that God is not like us, but He loves us and cares for us.

Draw a picture of the Trinity. You can draw three circles that represent the Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. Write their names inside the circles, and draw arrows between them to show that they are all one God.
Write down three things that you love about each person of the Trinity. For example, you might love the Father for His creation, the Son for His sacrifice, and the Holy Spirit for His guidance.

title: Question 9: Who is God?
question: Who is God?
answer: God is a Spirit, and does not have a body like men.
application: Because God is the creator of all things, He cannot be contained in a physical body like we are. Because God is a spirit, He can do more things that we can even imagine. Think of all the things God can do that we cannot because we are physical beings. God can be everywhere at the same time. God can speak into our hearts, and even dwell within us. Because God is not constrained by any physical limitations, He is capable of doing all things.
prayer: Lord God, you are a Spirit, you are not like us. While we are made in your image, we are also constrained on this earth by our physical bodies. Help us to remember that because you are a spirit, you can do all things, and be in all places. Lord, I thank you for your presence, and that I can call on you at any time. Help me to remember that you are always with me, and that I can trust in you to do all things according to your will. Amen
activities: Write down three things that God can do that you cannot do because He is a Spirit. Think of how amazing it is that God can do these things, and thank Him for being able to do them.

Think of other things that you cannot see, but you know they are there. For example, you cannot see the wind, but you can feel it. Write down three things that you cannot see, but you know they are there. How does this help you to understand that God is a Spirit?
song: Sing Holy, Holy Holy Lord God Almighty. This song reminds us that God is holy, and that He is a Spirit. As you sing, think about how amazing it is that God is not like us, but He loves us and cares for us.

title: Question 10: Where is God?
question: Where is God?
answer: God is everywhere.

title: Question 11: Can you see God?
question: Can you see God?
answer: No. I cannot see God, but he always sees me.

title: Question 12: Does God know all things?
question: Does God know all things?
answer: Yes. Nothing can be hidden from God.

title: Question 13: Can God do all things?
question: Can God do all things?
answer: Yes. God can do all his holy will.

title: Question 14: Where do you learn how to love and obey God?
question: Where do you learn how to love and obey God?
answer: In the Bible alone.

title: Question 15: Who wrote the Bible?
question: Who wrote the Bible?
answer: Holy men who were taught by the Holy Spirit.

title: Question 16: Who were our first parents?
question: Who were our first parents?
answer: Adam and Eve.

title: Question 17: Of what were our first parents made?
question: Of what were our first parents made?
answer: God made the body of Adam out of the ground, and formed Eve from the body of Adam.

title: Question 18: What did God give Adam and Eve besides bodies?
question: What did God give Adam and Eve besides bodies?
answer: He gave them souls that could never die.

title: Question 19: Have you a soul as well as a body?
question: Have you a soul as well as a body?
answer: Yes. I have a soul that can never die.

title: Question 20: How do you know that you have a soul?
question: How do you know that you have a soul?
answer: Because the Bible tells me so.

title: Question 21: What is your soul?
question: What is your soul?
answer: My soul includes all of me that should know and love God.

title: Question 22: In what condition did God make Adam and Eve?
question: In what condition did God make Adam and Eve?
answer: He made them holy and happy.

title: Question 23: Did Adam and Eve stay holy and happy?
question: Did Adam and Eve stay holy and happy?
answer: No. They sinned against God.

title: Question 24: What was the sin of our first parents?
question: What was the sin of our first parents?
answer: Eating the forbidden fruit.

title: Question 25: Why did they eat the forbidden fruit?
question: Why did they eat the forbidden fruit?
answer: Because they did not believe what God had said.

title: Question 26: Who tempted them to this sin?
question: Who tempted them to this sin?
answer: The devil tempted Eve, and she gave the fruit to Adam.

title: Question 27: What happened to our first parents when they had sinned?
question: What happened to our first parents when they had sinned?
answer: Instead of being holy and happy, they became sinful and miserable.

title: Question 28: What effect did the sin of Adam have on all mankind?
question: What effect did the sin of Adam have on all mankind?
answer: All mankind is born in a state of sin and misery.

title: Question 29: What do we inherit from Adam as a result of this original sin?
question: What do we inherit from Adam as a result of this original sin?
answer: A sinful nature.

title: Question 30: What is sin?
question: What is sin?
answer: Sin is any transgression of the law of God.

title: Question 31: What is meant by transgression?
question: What is meant by transgression?
answer: Doing what God forbids.

title: Question 32: What does every sin deserve?
question: What does every sin deserve?
answer: The anger and judgment of God.

title: Question 33: Do we know what God requires of us?
question: Do we know what God requires of us?
answer: Yes, he has given us his law both in our hearts and in writing.

title: Question 34: How many commandments did God give on Mt. Sinai?
question: How many commandments did God give on Mt. Sinai?
answer: Ten commandments.

title: Question 35: What are the ten commandments sometimes called?
question: What are the ten commandments sometimes called?
answer: God’s moral law.

title: Question 36: What do the first four commandments teach?
question: What do the first four commandments teach?
answer: Our duty to God.

title: Question 37: What do the last six commandments teach?
question: What do the last six commandments teach?
answer: Our duty to our fellow men.

title: Question 38: What is the sum of the ten commandments?
question: What is the sum of the ten commandments?
answer: To love God with all my heart, and my neighbor as myself.

title: Question 39: Who is your neighbor?
question: Who is your neighbor?
answer: All my fellow men are my neighbors.

title: Question 40: Is God pleased with those who love and obey him?
question: Is God pleased with those who love and obey him?
answer: Yes. He says, 'I love them that love me.'

title: Question 41: Is God pleased with those who do not love and obey him?
question: Is God pleased with those who do not love and obey him?
answer: No. 'God is angry with the wicked every day.'

title: Question 42: What is the first commandment?
question: What is the first commandment?
answer: The first commandment is, 'You shall have no other gods before me.'

title: Question 43: What does the first commandment teach us?
question: What does the first commandment teach us?
answer: To worship God only.

title: Question 44: What is the second commandment?
question: What is the second commandment?
answer: The second commandment is, 'You shall not make for yourself a carved image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth. You shall not bow down to them or serve them, for I the Lord your God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children to the third and the fourth generation of those who hate me, but showing steadfast love to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.'

title: Question 45: What does the second commandment teach us?
question: What does the second commandment teach us?
answer: To worship God in the right way, and to avoid idolatry.

title: Question 46: What is the third commandment?
question: What is the third commandment?
answer: The third commandment is, 'You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.'

title: Question 47: What does the third commandment teach us?
question: What does the third commandment teach us?
answer: To reverence God’s name, word, and works.

title: Question 48: What is the fourth commandment?
question: What is the fourth commandment?
answer: The fourth commandment is, 'Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy. Six days you shall labor, and do all your work, but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God. On it you shall not do any work, you, or your son, or your daughter, your male servant, or your female servant, or your livestock, or the sojourner who is within your gates. For in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested on the seventh day. Therefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day and made it holy.'

title: Question 49: What does the fourth commandment teach us?
question: What does the fourth commandment teach us?
answer: To keep the Sabbath holy.

title: Question 50: What day of the week is the Christian Sabbath?
question: What day of the week is the Christian Sabbath?
answer: The first day of the week, called the Lord’s Day.

title: Question 51: Why is it called the Lord’s Day?
question: Why is it called the Lord’s Day?
answer: Because on that day Christ rose from the dead.

title: Question 52: How should the Sabbath be kept?
question: How should the Sabbath be kept?
answer: In prayer and praise, in hearing and reading God’s Word, and in doing good to our fellow men.

title: Question 53: What is the fifth commandment?
question: What is the fifth commandment?
answer: The fifth commandment is, 'Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.'

title: Question 54: What does the fifth commandment teach us?
question: What does the fifth commandment teach us?
answer: To love and obey our parents.

title: Question 55: What is the sixth commandment?
question: What is the sixth commandment?
answer: The sixth commandment is, 'You shall not murder.'

title: Question 56: What does the sixth commandment teach us?
question: What does the sixth commandment teach us?
answer: To avoid hatred, all that leads to it, and all that follows from it.

title: Question 57: What is the seventh commandment?
question: What is the seventh commandment?
answer: The seventh commandment is, 'You shall not commit adultery.'

title: Question 58: What does the seventh commandment teach us?
question: What does the seventh commandment teach us?
answer: To be pure in heart, language and conduct.

title: Question 59: What is the eighth commandment?
question: What is the eighth commandment?
answer: The eighth commandment is, 'You shall not steal.'

title: Question 60: What does the eighth commandment teach us?
question: What does the eighth commandment teach us?
answer: To be honest and not to take the things of others.

title: Question 61: What is the ninth commandment?
question: What is the ninth commandment?
answer: The ninth commandment is, 'You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.'

title: Question 62: What does the ninth commandment teach us?
question: What does the ninth commandment teach us?
answer: To tell the truth and not to speak evil of others.

title: Question 63: What is the tenth commandment?
question: What is the tenth commandment?
answer: The tenth commandment is, 'You shall not covet your neighbor’s house; you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his male servant, or his female servant, or his ox, or his donkey, or anything that is your neighbor’s.'

title: Question 64: What does the tenth commandment teach us?
question: What does the tenth commandment teach us?
answer: To be content with what we have.

title: Question 65: Can any man keep these ten commandments?
question: Can any man keep these ten commandments?
answer: No mere man, since the fall of Adam, ever did or can keep the ten commandments perfectly.

title: Question 66: Of what use are the ten commandments to us?
question: Of what use are the ten commandments to us?
answer: They teach us our duty, make clear our condemnation, and show us our need of a Saviour.

title: Question 67: Does God condemn all men?
question: Does God condemn all men?
answer: No. Though he could justly have done so he has graciously entered into a covenant to save many.

title: Question 68: What is a covenant?
question: What is a covenant?
answer: A covenant is an agreement between two or more persons.

title: Question 69: What is the covenant of grace?
question: What is the covenant of grace?
answer: It is an eternal agreement within the Trinity to save certain persons called the elect, and to provide all the means for their salvation.

title: Question 70: What did Christ undertake in the covenant of grace?
question: What did Christ undertake in the covenant of grace?
answer: Christ undertook to keep the whole law for his people, and to suffer the punishment due to their sins.

title: Question 71: Did our Lord Jesus Christ ever sin?
question: Did our Lord Jesus Christ ever sin?
answer: No. He was holy, blameless and undefiled.

title: Question 72: How could the Son of God suffer?
question: How could the Son of God suffer?
answer: Christ, the Son of God, took flesh and blood, that he might obey and suffer as a man.

title: Question 73: What is meant by the atonement?
question: What is meant by the atonement?
answer: The atonement consists of Christ’s satisfying divine justice, by his sufferings and death, in the place of sinners.

title: Question 74: For whom did Christ obey and suffer?
question: For whom did Christ obey and suffer?
answer: Christ obeyed and suffered for those whom the Father had given him.

title: Question 75: What kind of life did Christ live on earth?
question: What kind of life did Christ live on earth?
answer: Christ lived a life of perfect obedience to the law of God.

title: Question 76: What kind of death did Christ die?
question: What kind of death did Christ die?
answer: Christ experienced the painful and shameful death of the cross.

title: Question 77: Who will be saved?
question: Who will be saved?
answer: Only those who repent of sin and believe in Christ will be saved.

title: Question 78: What is it to repent?
question: What is it to repent?
answer: Repentance involves sorrow for sin, leading one to hate and forsake it because it is displeasing to God.

title: Question 79: What is it to believe in Christ?
question: What is it to believe in Christ?
answer: A person believes who knows that his only hope is Christ and trusts in Christ alone for salvation.

title: Question 80: How were godly persons saved before the coming of Christ?
question: How were godly persons saved before the coming of Christ?
answer: They believed in the Saviour to come.

title: Question 81: How did they show their faith?
question: How did they show their faith?
answer: They offered sacrifices according to God’s commands.

title: Question 82: What did these sacrifices represent?
question: What did these sacrifices represent?
answer: They were symbolic of Christ, the Lamb of God, who was to die for sinners.

title: Question 83: What does Christ do for his people?
question: What does Christ do for his people?
answer: He does the work of a prophet, a priest and a king.

title: Question 84: How is Christ a prophet?
question: How is Christ a prophet?
answer: He teaches us the will of God, reveals God to us, and really was God in human flesh.

title: Question 85: Why do you need Christ as a prophet?
question: Why do you need Christ as a prophet?
answer: Because I am ignorant.

title: Question 86: How is Christ a priest?
question: How is Christ a priest?
answer: He died for our sins and prays to God for us.

title: Question 87: Why do you need Christ as a priest?
question: Why do you need Christ as a priest?
answer: Because I am guilty.

title: Question 88: How is Christ a king?
question: How is Christ a king?
answer: He rules over us and defends us.

title: Question 89: Why do you need Christ as a king?
question: Why do you need Christ as a king?
answer: Because I am weak and helpless.

title: Question 90: What did God the Father undertake in the covenant of grace?
question: What did God the Father undertake in the covenant of grace?
answer: By His goodness and mercy, God the Father elected, and determined to justify, adopt and sanctify those for whom Christ should die.

title: Question 91: What is election?
question: What is election?
answer: It is God’s goodness as revealed in his grace by choosing certain sinners for salvation.

title: Question 92: What is justification?
question: What is justification?
answer: It is God’s regarding sinners as if they had never sinned and granting them righteousness.

title: Question 93: What is righteousness?
question: What is righteousness?
answer: It is God’s viewing sinners as good, not for their own works, but for what Christ has done for them.

title: Question 94: Can anyone be saved by his own righteousness?
question: Can anyone be saved by his own righteousness?
answer: No. No one is good enough for God.

title: Question 95: What is adoption?
question: What is adoption?
answer: It is God’s making sinners into his children by grace.

title: Question 96: What is sanctification?
question: What is sanctification?
answer: It is God’s making sinners holy in heart and conduct.

title: Question 97: Is this change in all who are saved?
question: Is this change in all who are saved?
answer: Yes. All who are truly saved are changed by the Holy Spirit.

title: Question 98: What is repentance unto life?
question: What is repentance unto life?
answer: It is a saving grace, worked in the heart by the Holy Spirit, causing a sinner to turn from sin to God.

title: Question 99: What is faith in Jesus Christ?
question: What is faith in Jesus Christ?
answer: Faith in Jesus Christ is a saving grace, worked in the heart by the Holy Spirit, causing a sinner to receive and rest on Christ alone for salvation.

title: Question 100: Can you repent and believe in Christ by your own power?
question: Can you repent and believe in Christ by your own power?
answer: No. I can do nothing good without God’s Holy Spirit.

title: Question 101: How does the Holy Spirit baptize believers?
question: How does the Holy Spirit baptize believers?
answer: The Holy Spirit puts believers into the body of Christ by a spiritual union.

title: Question 102: How do you receive the Holy Spirit?
question: How do you receive the Holy Spirit?
answer: I must repent of my sins and believe in Christ.

title: Question 103: How long does the Holy Spirit stay with believers?
question: How long does the Holy Spirit stay with believers?
answer: The Holy Spirit dwells in believers forever.

title: Question 104: What does the Holy Spirit do for believers?
question: What does the Holy Spirit do for believers?
answer: The Holy Spirit teaches, comforts, and helps believers to pray and to understand God’s Word.

title: Question 105: What will become of the righteous?
question: What will become of the righteous?
answer: At death, the righteous will be taken to be with Christ, and at the last day will be raised in glory and made perfectly blessed in the full enjoyment of God forever.

title: Question 106: What will become of the wicked?
question: What will become of the wicked?
answer: At death, the wicked will be cast into hell, and at the last day will be raised to endure the wrath of God forever.

title: Question 107: What is prayer?
question: What is prayer?
answer: Prayer is talking with God.

title: Question 108: In whose name should we pray?
question: In whose name should we pray?
answer: Only in the name of Christ.

title: Question 109: What has Christ given to teach us how to pray?
question: What has Christ given to teach us how to pray?
answer: The Lord’s Prayer.

title: Question 110: Can you repeat the Lord’s Prayer?
question: Can you repeat the Lord’s Prayer?
answer: Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name. Your kingdom come, your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread, and forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory, forever. Amen.

title: Question 111: How many petitions are there in the Lord’s Prayer?
question: How many petitions are there in the Lord’s Prayer?
answer: Six.

title: Question 112: What is the first petition?
question: What is the first petition?
answer: Hallowed be your name.

title: Question 113: What do we pray for in the first petition?
question: What do we pray for in the first petition?
answer: That God’s name may be honored by us and all men.

title: Question 114: What is the second petition?
question: What is the second petition?
answer: Your kingdom come.

title: Question 115: What do we pray for in the second petition?
question: What do we pray for in the second petition?
answer: That the gospel may be preached in all the world, and believed and obeyed by us and all men.

title: Question 116: What is the third petition?
question: What is the third petition?
answer: Your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.

title: Question 117: What do we pray for in the third petition?
question: What do we pray for in the third petition?
answer: That men on earth may serve God as the angels do in heaven.

title: Question 118: What is the fourth petition?
question: What is the fourth petition?
answer: Give us this day our daily bread.

title: Question 119: What do we pray for in the fourth petition?
question: What do we pray for in the fourth petition?
answer: That God would give us all things needful for our bodies and souls.

title: Question 120: What is the fifth petition?
question: What is the fifth petition?
answer: And forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.

title: Question 121: What do we pray for in the fifth petition?
question: What do we pray for in the fifth petition?
answer: That God would pardon our sins for Christ’s sake, and enable us to forgive others.

title: Question 122: What is the sixth petition?
question: What is the sixth petition?
answer: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.

title: Question 123: What do we pray for in the sixth petition?
question: What do we pray for in the sixth petition?
answer: That God would keep us from sin and help us to obey him.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 124: How does the Holy Spirit bring us to salvation?
question: How does the Holy Spirit bring us to salvation?
answer: He uses the Bible, which is the Word of God.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 125: How can we know the Word of God?
question: How can we know the Word of God?
answer: We are to read and hear it with care and prayer.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 126: What is a church?
question: What is a church?
answer: An assembly of baptized believers joined together in covenant relationship to worship God and help one another keep His commands.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 127: What two ordinances did Christ give to his church?
question: What two ordinances did Christ give to his church?
answer: Baptism and the Lord’s Supper.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 128: Why did Christ give these ordinances?
question: Why did Christ give these ordinances?
answer: To show that his disciples belong to him, and to remind them of what he has done for them.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 129: What is baptism?
question: What is baptism?
answer: The immersion of a believer in water, in the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 130: What does baptism mean?
question: What does baptism mean?
answer: It means to show that the believer is united to Christ, has died to sin, and is raised to new life.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 131: Who should be baptized?
question: Who should be baptized?
answer: Only those who repent of their sins and believe in Christ for salvation.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 132: What is the Lord’s Supper?
question: What is the Lord’s Supper?
answer: The eating of bread and drinking of wine to remember the sufferings and death of Christ.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 133: Why was the Lord’s Supper given?
question: Why was the Lord’s Supper given?
answer: To remind Christians of Christ’s death for them and to help them feed on him in their hearts by faith.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 134: Who should partake of the Lord’s Supper?
question: Who should partake of the Lord’s Supper?
answer: Only those who repent of their sins, believe in Christ for salvation, and love their fellow men.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 135: Did Christ appoint other ordinances in his church?
question: Did Christ appoint other ordinances in his church?
answer: No. Baptism and the Lord’s Supper are the only two ordinances of Christ for the church.

section: The Word, The Church, and The Ordinances
title: Question 136: What is the visible church?
question: What is the visible church?
answer: The visible church is the organized body of professing believers in all ages and places.

title: Question 137: What is the invisible church?
question: What is the invisible church?
answer: The invisible church is the whole number of God’s elect, past, present, and future.

title: Question 138: What will happen to the righteous in the last day?
question: What will happen to the righteous in the last day?
answer: They will be raised to glory and will be made perfectly blessed in the full enjoyment of God forever.

title: Question 139: What will happen to the wicked in the last day?
question: What will happen to the wicked in the last day?
answer: They will be raised to endure the wrath of God forever.

title: Question 140: What is heaven?
question: What is heaven?
answer: Heaven is the glorious and happy place where the saved will be with Christ forever.

title: Question 141: What is hell?
question: What is hell?
answer: Hell is the dreadful and unhappy place where the lost will be punished forever.

title: Question 142: What will God do to the wicked in hell?
question: What will God do to the wicked in hell?
answer: He will punish them forever.

title: Question 143: What will God do for the righteous in heaven?
question: What will God do for the righteous in heaven?
answer: He will reward them forever.

title: Question 144: In light of these truths, what should you do?
question: In light of these truths, what should you do?
answer: I should strive to trust in Christ, love God, and keep his commandments.

title: Question 145: What is your only comfort in life and death?
question: What is your only comfort in life and death?
answer: That I am not my own, but belong to my faithful Savior, Jesus Christ, who has fully paid for all my sins and watches over me in such a way that not a hair can fall from my head without the will of my Father in heaven.
